entry.title: Reflections on time well spent
entry.content:
I began my descent into writing code as a lonely journey. When I say lonely I mean an venture which for all intents and purposes solo. My only friends were my tools, a handful of books, and Google. Google provided answers. Google provided many, many answers, and I beat her constantly until she gave them up. My enviroment constricted in that I had no internet access, at least none that amounted to anything. In the beginning hacking away on a smuggled copy of notepad++ I typed and there was html. Somehow to everyone around me this was magic. I created more, and found a book, and poorly crafted PHP sprung from my fingertips. Functions piled on top of functions, file followed file. I was awash in pile after pile of code and not the faintest sense of organization.

Then I was greated by new ideas. Object Oriented Programming, and then frameworks, CodeIgniter, Laravel among the chief ones. I implemented them, but never understood them. Like the sorceror’s apprentice playing with magicks far beyond my ken. I could follow along in the various spellbooks Google brought me, but never really understood how they worked.

In the end I found Tealeaf Academy. Here at last I am going back to the basics and leanring how to develop on the web from the ground up. I won’t say that everything I have done up to this point has been in vain. I can clearly see that I understand some of the topics more deeply than the course goes, but other aspects I lack in completeness. It is also giving a better sense of how to think as a devloper, and equipping me with the tools to get the job done.

I’m going to try and catalog my experiences here more fully as I go along. Post links to my projects, code snippets, and my general musings.
